summary.para: Retrieves the center point of the manipulation in content coordinates. If there is no manipulation in progress, retrieves the center point of the viewport.

param.name: centerX
param.para: The center on the horizontal axis.

param.name: centerY
param.para: The center on the vertical axis.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Gets the final transform, including inertia, of the primary content.

param.name: matrix
param.para: The transformed matrix that represents the inertia ending position.

param.name: pointCount
param.para: The size of the matrix.
This value is always 6, because a 3x2 matrix is used for all direct manipulation transforms.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Warning Calling this method can cause a race condition if inertia has ended or been interrupted. This can also occur during the OnViewportStatusChanged callback.

summary.para: Sets the horizontal alignment of the primary content relative to the viewport.

param.name: alignment
param.para: One or more values from DIRECTMANIPULATION_HORIZONTALALIGNMENT. The default is DIRECTMANIPULATION_HORIZONTALALIGNMENT_NONE.

Note You cannot combine the following options: DIRECTMANIPULATION_HORIZONTALALIGNMENT_LEFT, DIRECTMANIPULATION-HORIZONTALALIGNMENT_CENTER, DIRECTMANIPULATION_HORIZONTALALIGNMENT_RIGHT. DIRECTMANIPULATION_HORIZONTALALIGNMENT_UNLOCKCENTER can be combined with any option but cannot be configured by itself.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If you have activated a configuration consisting only of zoom or zoom inertia, specify DIRECTMANIPULATION_HORIZONTALALIGNMENT_UNLOCKCENTER to respect the zoom center point.

summary.para: Specifies the coordinate system for snap points or snap intervals.

param.name: motion
param.para: One of the values from DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TYPES.

param.name: coordinate
param.para: One of the values from DIRECTMANIPULATION_SNAPPOINT_COORDINATE.
If motion is set to translation (DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TRANSLATEX or DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TRANSLATEY), all values of DIRECTMANIPULATION_SNAPPOINT_COORDINATE are valid.
If motion is set to DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_ZOOM, only DIRECTMANIPULATION_COORDINATE_ORIGIN of DIRECTMANIPULATION_SNAPPOINT_COORDINATE is valid (origin must be set to 0.0f).

param.name: origin
param.para: The initial, or starting, snap point. All snap points are relative to this one. Only used when DIRECTMANIPULATION_COORDINATE_ORIGIN is set.
If motion is set to DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_ZOOM, then origin must be set to 0.0f.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: The origin is relative to the content boundaries. If no boundary has been set (SetContentRect is never called) the default boundaries are (-FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX).

summary.para: Specifies snap points for the inertia end position at uniform intervals.

param.name: motion
param.para: One of the DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TYPES enumeration values.

param.name: interval
param.para: The interval between each snap point.

param.name: offset
param.para: The offset from the coordinate specified in SetSnapCoordinate.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Snap point locations are in content coordinate units.
Specify snap points through SetSnapPoints or SetSnapInterval.
If snap points are invalid (for example, outside of the content boundaries), they are ignored and the content is always within the content boundaries.
Snap points are not at boundaries by default. If you wish for content to stop at a boundary, a snap point must be set at the boundary.
Snap points set by SetSnapInterval can be cleared by calling SetSnapInterval with an interval of 0.0f.
The following example shows how to set the coordinate system for X translation snap points to the origin. Snap points are set every 45 pixels, beginning at the origin along the X-axis.
remarks.code: HRESULT hr = SetSnapCoordinate(testWindow, 0, DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TRANSLATEX, DIRECTMANIPULATION_COORDINATE_ORIGIN, 0.0f); hr = pContent->SetSnapInterval(DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TRANSLATEX, 45.0f, 0.0f);

summary.para: Specifies the snap points for the inertia rest position.

param.name: motion
param.para: One or more of the DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TYPES enumeration values. Only DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TRANSLATE_X, DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TRANSLATE_Y, or DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_ZOOM are allowed.

param.name: points
param.para: An array of snap points within the boundaries of the content to snap to. Should be specified in increasing order relative to the origin set in SetSnapCoordinate.

param.name: pointCount
param.para: The size of the array of snap points. Should be greater than 0.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If there is no change in the snap points, this method can return S_FALSE. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. If invalid snap points are specified, existing snap points might be affected.

remarks.para: If snap points are invalid (for example, outside of the content boundaries), they are ignored and the content is always within the content boundaries.

summary.para: Specifies the type of snap point.

param.name: motion
param.para: One or more of the DIRECTMANIPULATION_MOTION_TYPES enumeration values.

param.name: type
param.para: One of the DIRECTMANIPULATION_SNAPPOINT_TYPE enumeration values.
If set to DIRECTMANIPULATION_SNAPPOINT_TYPE_NONE, snap points specified through SetSnapPoints or SetSnapInterval are cleared.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Specifies the vertical alignment of the primary content in the viewport.

param.name: alignment
param.para: One or more values from DIRECTMANIPULATION_VERTICALALIGNMENT.

Note You cannot combine DIRECTMANIPULATION_VERTICALALIGNMENT_TOP, DIRECTMANIPULATION_VERTICALALIGNMENT_CENTER, or DIRECTMANIPULATION_VERTICALALIGNMENT_BOTTOM. DIRECTMANIPULATION_VERTICALALIGNMENT_UNLOCKCENTER can be combined with any option but cannot be configured by itself.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If you have activated a configuration consisting only of zoom or zoom inertia, specify DIRECTMANIPULATION_VERTICALALIGNMENT_UNLOCKCENTER to respect the zoom center point.
The following example shows how to use this method.

summary.para: Specifies the minimum and maximum boundaries for zoom.

param.name: zoomMinimum
param.para: The minimum zoom level allowed. Must be greater than or equal to 0.1f, which corresponds to 100% zoom.

param.name: zoomMaximum
param.para: The maximum zoom allowed. Must be greater than zoomMinimum and less than FLT_MAX.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: If the content is outside the new boundaries, and the viewport is ENABLED or READY, then the content is reset to be within the new boundaries. If inertia configuration is enabled, the reset operation uses an inertia animation.

summary.para: Encapsulates the primary content inside a viewport. Primary content is the content specified during the creation of a viewport.
